metadata.title: Tamil Classical Moral Literature Foundation
metadata.description: Complete Aathichoodi (109 verses) and Konrai Venthan (91 verses) by Avvaiyar
metadata.author: Avvaiyar (ஔவையார்)

aathichoodi.title: ஆத்திசூடி
aathichoodi.description: A collection of 109 single-line moral aphorisms, each starting with a letter of the Tamil alphabet in order

verses.meaning_english: Desire to do righteous deeds
Let anger subside; cool down your temper
Do not hide what you can afford to give
Do not prevent charity or giving
Do not boast about your possessions
Do not give up enthusiasm and perseverance
Do not despise numbers and letters; respect education
Begging is disgraceful
Give alms before you eat
Conduct yourself according to social norms
Never stop learning and studying
Do not speak with envy or jealousy
Forget harsh and angry words
Protecting others is the true penance
Live with rightful ownership and responsibility
Remove lowly and mean behavior
Do not abandon good character
Do not separate those who are united
Stop destructive actions
Strive to learn by listening
Do not hide your skills and craftsmanship
Do not desire to plunder or loot
Avoid harmful games and sports
Remove slander and gossip
Stand by the wheel of dharma; follow the righteous path
Be in the company of the wise and learned
Do not speak with false embellishments
Do not forget excellence and dignity
Do not speak words that disgust listeners
Do not desire gambling
Do things well and perfectly
Know and join the right place and company
Do not roam inviting contempt
Do not falter in your words
Do not wander lazily
Speak pleasantly and sweetly
Move about as a worthy person
Desire to give charity
Serve the divine Lord
Remove evil deeds
Do not give room for sorrow
Think before you act; act with deliberation
Do not despise God
Live in harmony with your country
Do not heed harmful counsel from women
Do not forget old friendships
Do not pursue things that lead to defeat
Adhere to goodness
Do what the country approves
Do not deviate from your position
Do not play in water recklessly
Do not indulge in subtle vices
Learn many books and scriptures
Cultivate paddy; practice agriculture
Conduct yourself honestly
Do not approach destructive deeds
Do not speak worthless words
Do not give room for disease
Do not speak of blameworthy things
Do not associate with the wicked (like snakes)
Do not speak erroneously
Stand to gain greatness
Live honoring those who praised you
Cultivate the land and then eat
Take elders and the wise as your support
Remove ignorance and foolishness
Do not associate with fools
Live protecting your wealth
Do not engage in warfare unnecessarily
Do not let your mind waver
Do not give place to enemies
Do not exaggerate when speaking
Do not desire to overeat
Do not stand at the front of battle unnecessarily
Do not associate with the obstinate and rude
Embrace the shoulders of a good wife
Listen to the words of the noble
Stay away from the house of courtesans
Speak words of righteousness
Hate excessive desire and lust
Do not boast about your strength
Do not initiate arguments
Desire knowledge and learning
Stand to attain liberation (moksha)
Be a noble and virtuous person
Do not abandon enthusiasm
Do not speak harshly
Do not intentionally do evil deeds
Wake up at dawn
Desire unity and harmony
Work without rest
Do not be proud saying 'I'
Live by giving to those who ask
Sleep on cotton from the silk-cotton tree
Understand the valor of the capable
Do not desire beauty to be destroyed
Know the truth
Do not deviate from the path of righteousness
Do not become drowsy from lack of sleep
Do not reduce the measure of grains; be honest in weighing
Know the value and love accordingly
Learn in your youth
Be humble even in high positions
Desire simplicity
Do at least one good deed
Do not despise what you have learned
Perform penance as the primary duty
Do compassionate deeds
Attain mental tranquility

konrai_venthan.title: கொன்றை வேந்தன்
konrai_venthan.description: A collection of 91 two-line moral couplets by Avvaiyar, each teaching practical wisdom for daily life

verses.meaning_tamil: தாயும் தந்தையும் முதலில் அறிய வேண்டிய கடவுள்
verses.meaning_english: Mother and father are the first gods to know
Worshipping at temples is very good

verses.meaning_tamil: இல்லறம் அல்லாமல் வேறு நல்ல அறம் இல்லை
verses.meaning_english: There is no virtue greater than family life
What the miser hoards, the wicked will take
When the wealthy fall, the active will claim their wealth
Enthusiasm is the beauty of prosperity
Numbers and letters are like eyes

verses.meaning_tamil: சொல்லாமல் செய்யும் மக்கள் மூப்பு வராத மருந்து
verses.meaning_english: Children who act without being told are the medicine against aging
Even in doubt, do what must be done
Trust one person and stay in one place
Maintaining good conduct is better than mere recitation
Only the learned have true eyes
Unseen dreams will not be fulfilled
Know what grows from the tradition of kin
Even to those of lower status, speak humbly
If you look for faults, you will have no relations
Even with keen observation, you can be deceived again
If doing harm, abandoning it is duty
Even in ruin, think of creation
See the true value in what you have in hand
He who does not kill and abstains from meat elevates his lineage
Cruel rulers will face great ruin
The growth of progeny is called bondage
Keep the words of the wise in your heart

verses.meaning_tamil: சிறிய கூட்டம் சேராமல் இருந்தால் நல்ல கூட்டம் கிடைக்கும்
verses.meaning_english: Avoiding bad company brings good company
Look at the name of one who seeks excellence
Embracing relatives is complete friendship
Gambling and arguments cause suffering
Do not forget your penance; you may gain a master
Know the right place to join and live there

verses.meaning_tamil: சொல் தவம் இல்லாதவரிடம் பெற்ற தவம் கொள்
verses.meaning_english: Take gained wisdom from those who lack word-penance
Abandon the weakness called laziness
Without wisdom, there is no wealth

verses.meaning_tamil: தந்தையின் சொல்லை விட உயர்ந்த மந்திரம் இல்லை
verses.meaning_english: There is no mantra greater than a father's words

verses.verse: தாய் சொல் தட்டேல் வாய் சுவை கெடும்
verses.transliteration: Thaai sol thattel vaai suvai kedum
verses.meaning_tamil: தாயின் சொல்லை மறுத்தால் வாயின் சுவை கெடும்
verses.meaning_english: If you refuse mother's words, taste in your mouth will be lost
By divine grace, understand the secrets of scriptures
Do not think of ending undying fame
Leave sorrow and see the directions (opportunities)
Learn praised texts and gain elevation
He who does not worship God loses truth
Finding without searching is rare
If you trust only in women, the world will be deceived
Those who work become wealthy

verses.meaning_tamil: தோள் இணையை மாற்றினால் ஆள் இணை கெடும்
verses.meaning_english: If you change shoulder partners, your pair will be ruined
If you see good, evil will go away

verses.verse: நாள் எனின் மறவேல் நாள் என கருது
verses.transliteration: Naal enin maravel naal ena karudhu
verses.meaning_tamil: நாள் என்றால் மறவாதே, நாள் என கருது
verses.meaning_english: If it is a day, do not forget; think of it as a day

verses.meaning_tamil: நிலையான தொழிலில் நில், மலையை விட உயர்வாய்
verses.meaning_english: Stand in steady work; you will rise higher than mountains

verses.verse: நீள் பணி செய்வோன் நாள் மாறி இருக்கும்
verses.transliteration: Neel pani seivon naal maari irukkum
verses.meaning_tamil: நீண்ட பணி செய்பவன் நாள் மாறி இருக்கும்
verses.meaning_english: One who does long service will have days change for the better
Enjoy what should be enjoyed and live without fault

verses.verse: நூல் அறி பண்டிதன் வேல் அறி மன்னன்
verses.transliteration: Nool ari pandithan vel ari mannan
verses.meaning_tamil: நூல் அறிந்தவன் பண்டிதன், வேல் அறிந்தவன் மன்னன்
verses.meaning_english: He who knows texts is a scholar; he who knows the spear is a king

verses.meaning_tamil: நெல்லும் உயிர் வளர்க்கும், புல்லும் உணவு தேடும்
verses.meaning_english: Rice sustains life; even grass seeks food

verses.meaning_tamil: நேர்மையான நிலை இல்லாதவர் உலக நிலை அறியார்
verses.meaning_english: Those without honesty do not know the state of the world

verses.meaning_tamil: நெகிழும் தன்மை இல்லாதவர் உய்வு வளம் இல்லாதவர்
verses.meaning_english: Those without flexibility lack prosperity of salvation
Do not speak to hurt those who are already suffering

verses.meaning_tamil: நோற்றால் பிழைப்பு வரும், ஏற்றால் நோய் வரும்
verses.meaning_english: Fasting brings survival; accepting brings disease

verses.verse: பருவத்தே பயிர் செய் கருமத்தே கண் வை
verses.transliteration: Paruvathe payir sei karumathe kan vai
verses.meaning_tamil: பருவ காலத்தில் பயிர் செய், செயலில் கவனம் வை
verses.meaning_english: Sow in season; keep an eye on your deeds
One must observe the elephant along with milk (care in nurturing)
Do not beg; live without fear

verses.verse: பீடு பெற எண்ணு நாடு புகழ் கொள்
verses.transliteration: Peedu pera ennu naadu pugazh kol
verses.meaning_tamil: பெருமை பெற எண்ணு, நாட்டின் புகழ் கொள்
verses.meaning_english: Think of gaining greatness; take the country's fame
Live as long as one who nurtured lowly deeds lives
Walk with the earth's moral conduct
Serve your parents; relatives will multiply
Those with greatness do not speak rudely
If you walk slowly, the world will support you
If you think about it, you will understand the value of gold
Keep your vision under the blanket (be discrete)
Understand the enemy's strength and then advance
Stand and understand the state of lightning (impermanence)
The fruit of rising action brings immersed welfare
Penance done in the morning bears fruit in the afternoon
Listen to elders' words; they will protect you
If you study much, truth will be known
The earth's command follows justice
If what you say is false, your work will perish
If you are silent, wisdom will arise
The capable one is Valluvan; everyone should honor him
If you live knowing your life span, ruin will leave
Those without seed have no purity
He who protects his home will join his country
If you want victory, you need unity
The fruit of the Vedas is attaining liberation
Worship God every day

verses.verse: வொய்யார் சொல் கேளேல் மெய்யார் சொல் கேள்
verses.transliteration: Voiyaar sol kelel meiyaar sol kel
verses.meaning_tamil: பொய்யர் சொல் கேளாதே, மெய்யர் சொல் கேள்
verses.meaning_english: Do not listen to liars; listen to the truthful
Do not cause trouble to anyone

verses.verse: இரவலர் புகழ் தருவோர் தம் புகழ் செய்
verses.transliteration: Iravalar pugazh tharuvor tham pugazh sei
verses.meaning_tamil: யாசகர் புகழ் தருவோர் தம் புகழ் செய்வர்
verses.meaning_english: Those who give fame to beggars create their own fame

verses.verse: இலமென்று அசைவு இல் இலமென்று அயர்வு இல்
verses.transliteration: Ilamenru asaivu il ilamenru ayarvu il
verses.meaning_tamil: இல்லை என்று அசைவு இல்லை, இல்லை என்று சோர்வு இல்லை
verses.meaning_english: Saying 'I have not' causes no movement; saying 'I have not' causes no weariness

verses.meaning_tamil: பொறாமை உள்ள மனத்தவனுக்கு ஆக்கம் போன்றது இல்லை
verses.meaning_english: One with envy in heart has nothing like prosperity
Since thought achieves what is thought, thinking itself is thinking

verses.transliteration: Arivilaan nenju uril pori payilum veriye
verses.meaning_tamil: அறிவில்லாதவன் நெஞ்சில் உறைந்தால் புலன்கள் வெறியை பயிலும்
verses.meaning_english: If ignorance dwells in heart, senses practice frenzy
Forgetting gratitude is not good
Search firmly for grains and money
